html: cedars of Lebanon/oaks of Bashan. Bashan is a region east of the Jordan River and north of ancient Gilead in Israel; Lebanon is a mountain range in Syria known for its fine cedars. Symbolically, the scriptures consistently use trees to represent men. Green trees are righteous people (Ps. 1:3; D&C 135:6), and dry trees represent the wicked (Luke 23:31; 3 Ne. 14:17-18). In the context of Isa. 2:11-21, oaks and cedars are like proud people, who, Isaiah informs us, are "high and lifted up," and the "day of the Lord" shall come upon them too.
